[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/experiments.rs] [Optimization determinism] Do optimization experiments (OPTIMIZE, OPTIMIZE_EXTRA, etc.) guarantee deterministic output across different compilations, or can they produce semantically equivalent but binary-different bytecode? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/experiments.rs] [Experiment interaction] Can the combination of INLINING=on, DEAD_CODE_ELIMINATION=on, and VARIABLE_COALESCING=on create emergent bugs that don't occur with any single optimization? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/experiments.rs] [Safety check interaction] Can disabling ABILITY_CHECK while keeping ACCESS_CHECK enabled create inconsistent type system enforcement? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/experiments.rs] [Optimization vs safety] Can enabling all optimizations (OPTIMIZE=on, OPTIMIZE_EXTRA=on) while disabling safety checks (CHECKS=off) create bytecode that is optimized but violates Move semantics? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/experiments.rs] [Lines: 295-300] [Production testing flag detection] Is there runtime detection to prevent COMPILE_FOR_TESTING=on from being used in mainnet deployments, or can test code accidentally make it to production? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/experiments.rs] [Lines: 289-293] [Production unsafe flag detection] Does the compiler warn when UNSAFE_PACKAGE_VISIBILITY=on is used outside of testing/prover contexts, or can it be silently enabled in production? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/experiments.rs] [Inheritance graph] Can the lack of a formal dependency graph between experiments cause inconsistent states where child experiments are enabled but their parent meta-experiments are disabled? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/experiments.rs] [Bidirectional dependencies] Can experiments that inherit from each other create subtle ordering dependencies that cause different behavior depending on resolution order? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/experiments.rs] [Lines: 314-366] [Constant naming] Can typos in experiment constant names (e.g., typing ACCESS_CHEK instead of ACCESS_CHECK) cause wrong experiments to be referenced, silently disabling intended checks? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/experiments.rs] [Lines: 315-366] [String literal consistency] Are the string literals (e.g., 'ability-check') verified to match their constant usage locations, or can mismatches cause lookup failures? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/experiments.rs] [Lines: 307-310] [BTreeMap ordering] Does any code incorrectly assume experiment processing order based on BTreeMap's sorted ordering rather than explicit dependencies? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/experiments.rs] [Experiment.description] Can maliciously long or malformed description strings cause buffer overflows or injection attacks when descriptions are displayed in error messages or help text? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/experiments.rs] [Lines: 120-123] [INLINING_OPTIMIZATION_TO_NON_PRIMARY_TARGETS] Can restricting inlining optimization to primary targets create inconsistent optimization levels between framework and application code, causing linking or performance issues? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/experiments.rs] [Lines: 115-118] [ACROSS_PACKAGE_INLINING cross-boundary] Does across-package inlining correctly preserve module access control boundaries, or can it leak private implementation details across package boundaries? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/experiments.rs] [Default value conflicts] Can experiments with Inherited defaults that point to experiments with Given defaults create logical conflicts if the inheritance chain is modified? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/experiments.rs] [Default value changes] If an experiment's default changes from Given(true) to Given(false), are all dependent experiments that inherit from it properly updated? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/experiments.rs] [Lines: 23] [Clone derive] Since Experiment is #[derive(Clone)], can cloning experiments with Inherited defaults create dangling references if the parent experiment is removed? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/experiments.rs] [Experiment metadata] Can experiment names, descriptions, or defaults be extracted via reflection or introspection to leak information about compiler security features? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/experiments.rs] [MVC_EXP vs MOVE_COMPILER_EXP] Does the check for both MVC_EXP and MOVE_COMPILER_EXP create precedence confusion where attackers can set both to conflicting values? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/experiments.rs] [Environment variable override] Can environment variables set by the system override user-specified command line arguments, bypassing intended compiler configuration? (Medium)
